intro: Sterculia cognata, commonly known as the African sycamore, is a deciduous tree native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy, pale yellow or greenish flowers. The tree produces woody capsules that contain numerous small, hard seeds. Its bark is thick and fissured, often exuding a milky sap when wounded. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in forest margins and riverine habitats.
